net.wombatrpgs.mgne.data
Class DataLoader

java.lang.Object
  net.wombatrpgs.mgne.data.DataLoader
Direct Known Subclasses:
DirectoryDataLoader
public abstract class DataLoader
extends java.lang.Object

An superclass for all classes that load and handle databases. This is split into abstract because it's possible to read in files from both the normal res folder like a normal person and from compressed game data somewhere. It's encryption, so you know it's special!

Method Detail

loadData

public java.util.List<MainSchema> loadData(java.lang.String dataDirectory)
Loads all the data files from the directory specified by the string. Note that in the case of compressed files, that dataDirectory could actually be one giant blob. In theory dataDirectory is a directory path and name but I guess subclasses could do weird things. Result is an arraylist of all schema that were loaded. They're unsorted, just by the way, but you can get their class to do neat things with them. Probably the best thing to do is to drop them all into their own little bag by class.

Parameters:
dataDirectory - The file to load in data files from
Returns:
A list of all schema that were there~

getParserCounter

public LoadingBarCounter getParserCounter()
Gets the counter used by the actual mapper for turning shit into usable schema. For use in loading bars.

Returns:
The parser's update counter

setDirectory

protected abstract void setDirectory(java.lang.String dataDirectory)
A meta-constructor called before loading data. Think of it as a chance to zero everything out. File accessing should be done here and the preloaded loading bar counter should be incremented!

parsePreloaded

protected void parsePreloaded(PreloadedData preload)
Turns a chunk of preloaded data into meaningful code.

Parameters:
preload - The preloaded data to pase

recursivelyGetFiles

protected static java.util.List<java.io.File> recursivelyGetFiles(java.io.File root)
Returns all files in the root directory, recursively. Does not include directories. Static helper.

Parameters:
root - The root directory to get files from
Returns:
An ArrayList of all those files
